import Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Field.Basic
import Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Uniform
import Mathlib.Order.CompletePartialOrder

/-! ## `Real` manipulation lemmas -/

open Function Set
open scoped Real

variable {ι : Type*} [Nonempty ι] {s : Set ι}

namespace Real

lemma exists_biSup_lt_add_eps {f : ι → ℝ} {ε : ℝ} (εpos : 0 < ε) (hs : s.Nonempty)
    (hf : BddAbove (f '' s)) (hf' : ∀ x ∈ s, 0 ≤ f x) :
    ∃ x ∈ s, ⨆ z ∈ s, f z < f x + ε := by
  have lub := isLUB_ciSup_set hf hs
  have sc : (⨆ (i : s), f i) = ⨆ i ∈ s, f i := by
    haveI := Nonempty.to_subtype hs
    apply ciSup_subtype (by rwa [← image_eq_range]); rw [sSup_empty]
    apply iSup_nonneg; simpa using hf'
  rw [sc, isLUB_iff_le_iff] at lub; by_contra! h
  have mub : (⨆ i ∈ s, f i) - ε / 2 ∈ upperBounds (f '' s) := fun x mx ↦ by
    rw [mem_image] at mx; obtain ⟨i, mi, ei⟩ := mx; specialize h i mi; rw [ei] at h
    linarith
  rw [← lub ((⨆ i ∈ s, f i) - ε / 2)] at mub
  linarith

end Real

Your statement is true (you proved it!) but it probably doesn't say what you think it says: ⨆ z ∈ s, f z is not the maximum of f over s: it is the maximum over all x, of "if x is in s then f x else the supremum of the empty set, i.e., 0". So even if f is constant equal to -1, this supremum will be 0 if s is not everything.

Long story short: over conditionally complete spaces like the reals, never write ⨆ z ∈ s, f z and use ⨆ (z : s), f z instead. If some lemmas in Carleson use the wording ⨆ z ∈ s, f z for real-valued f, they should be changed. Note that the situation is very different for functions taking values in a complete order, like ennreal, because the issue disappears there. That's the reason why we don't have lemmas for biSup in conditionally complete lattices.

@Sébastien Gouëzel oh, this is what I actually wanted, which has now been pushed to the PR there:

import Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Bounded
import Mathlib.Order.CompletePartialOrder

open Set Bornology
open scoped NNReal

variable {ι : Type*} {s : Set ι} {E : Type*} [SeminormedAddCommGroup E]

namespace ENNReal

lemma exists_biSup_le_enorm_add_eps
    {f : ι → E} {ε : ℝ≥0} (εpos : 0 < ε) (hs : s.Nonempty) (hf : IsBounded (range f)) :
    ∃ x ∈ s, ⨆ z ∈ s, ‖f z‖ₑ ≤ ‖f x‖ₑ + ε := by
  obtain ⟨i₀, mi₀⟩ := hs; set A := ⨆ z ∈ s, ‖f z‖ₑ
  have lub : IsLUB ((‖f ·‖ₑ) '' s) A := isLUB_biSup
  rw [isLUB_iff_le_iff] at lub
  by_contra! h
  specialize lub (A - ε)
  have key : A - ε ∈ upperBounds ((‖f ·‖ₑ) '' s) := fun i mi ↦ by
    rw [mem_image] at mi; obtain ⟨x, mx, hx⟩ := mi
    specialize h x mx; rw [hx] at h; exact ENNReal.le_sub_of_add_le_right (by simp) h.le
  rw [← lub] at key
  have Ant : A ≠ ⊤ := by -- boundedness of `f` used here
    by_contra! h; simp_rw [A, iSup₂_eq_top] at h; apply absurd h; push_neg
    rw [isBounded_iff_forall_norm_le] at hf; obtain ⟨C, hC⟩ := hf
    simp_rw [mem_range, forall_exists_index, forall_apply_eq_imp_iff] at hC
    lift C to ℝ≥0 using (norm_nonneg _).trans (hC i₀)
    use C, by simp, fun i mi ↦ by exact_mod_cast hC i
  obtain ⟨B, eB⟩ : ∃ B : ℝ≥0, A = B := Option.ne_none_iff_exists'.mp Ant
  have εlA : ε < A := le_add_self.trans_lt (h i₀ mi₀)
  rw [eB, coe_lt_coe] at εlA
  rw [eB, ← ENNReal.coe_sub, coe_le_coe, ← NNReal.coe_le_coe, NNReal.coe_sub εlA.le,
    le_sub_self_iff] at key
  rw [← NNReal.coe_pos] at εpos; linarith only [εpos, key]

lemma exists_enorm_sub_eps_le_biInf
    {f : ι → E} {ε : ℝ≥0} (εpos : 0 < ε) (hs : s.Nonempty) :
    ∃ x ∈ s, ‖f x‖ₑ - ε ≤ ⨅ z ∈ s, ‖f z‖ₑ := by
  obtain ⟨i₀, mi₀⟩ := hs; set A := ⨅ z ∈ s, ‖f z‖ₑ
  have glb : IsGLB ((‖f ·‖ₑ) '' s) A := isGLB_biInf
  rw [isGLB_iff_le_iff] at glb
  by_contra! h
  specialize glb (A + ε)
  have key : A + ε ∈ lowerBounds ((‖f ·‖ₑ) '' s) := fun i mi ↦ by
    rw [mem_image] at mi; obtain ⟨x, mx, hx⟩ := mi
    specialize h x mx; rw [hx] at h; exact (lt_tsub_iff_right.mp h).le
  rw [← glb] at key
  have Ant : A ≠ ⊤ := (h i₀ mi₀).ne_top
  obtain ⟨B, eB⟩ : ∃ B : ℝ≥0, A = B := Option.ne_none_iff_exists'.mp Ant
  rw [eB, ← ENNReal.coe_add, coe_le_coe, ← NNReal.coe_le_coe, NNReal.coe_add,
    add_le_iff_nonpos_right] at key
  rw [← NNReal.coe_pos] at εpos; linarith only [εpos, key]

end ENNReal

Ah, the story is indeed completely different in ennreal. Here we have supporting lemmas, which make it possible to golf your proof quite a bit, for instance with

lemma exists_biSup_le_enorm_add_eps
    {f : ι → E} {ε : ℝ≥0} (εpos : 0 < ε) (hs : s.Nonempty) (hf : IsBounded (range f)) :
    ∃ x ∈ s, ⨆ z ∈ s, ‖f z‖ₑ ≤ ‖f x‖ₑ + ε := by
  by_contra! H
  have M : ⨆ z ∈ s, (‖f z‖ₑ + ε) ≤ ⨆ z ∈ s, ‖f z‖ₑ := by
    simpa only [iSup_le_iff] using fun i hi ↦ (H i hi).le
  have Ant : ⨆ z ∈ s, ‖f z‖ₑ ≠ ⊤ := by -- boundedness of `f` used here
    obtain ⟨i₀, mi₀⟩ := hs
    by_contra! h; simp_rw [iSup₂_eq_top] at h; apply absurd h; push_neg
    rw [isBounded_iff_forall_norm_le] at hf; obtain ⟨C, hC⟩ := hf
    simp_rw [mem_range, forall_exists_index, forall_apply_eq_imp_iff] at hC
    lift C to ℝ≥0 using (norm_nonneg _).trans (hC i₀)
    use C, by simp, fun i mi ↦ by exact_mod_cast hC i
  obtain ⟨B, eB⟩ : ∃ B : ℝ≥0, ⨆ z ∈ s, ‖f z‖ₑ = B := Option.ne_none_iff_exists'.mp Ant
  rw [← biSup_add hs, eB] at M
  norm_cast at M
  exact lt_irrefl _ (M.trans_lt (lt_add_of_pos_right B εpos))
(I've copied your proof of Ant without trying to golf it, but as you can see the rest of the proof is now just a few lines)
(and the right assumption is probably not that the range of f is bounded, but only that f '' s is bounded)
